00042 typedef unsigned long long rthal_time_t;

00044 #define __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l) ({                  \
00045         union { unsigned long long _ull;                \
00046             struct { u_long _h; u_long _l; } _s; } _u;  \
00047         _u._ull = (ull);                                \
00048         (h) = _u._s._h;                                 \
00049         (l) = _u._s._l;                                 \
00050         })
00051 
00052 #define __rthal_u64fromu32(h, l) ({                     \
00053         union { unsigned long long _ull;                \
00054             struct { u_long _h; u_long _l; } _s; } _u;  \
00055         _u._s._h = (h);                                 \
00056         _u._s._l = (l);                                 \
00057         _u._ull;                                        \
00058         })
00059 
00060 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ullmul(const unsigned long m0, 
00061                                               const unsigned long m1)
00062 {
00063     return (unsigned long long) m0 * m1;
00064 }
00065 
00066 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00067                                                const unsigned long uld,
00068                                                unsigned long *const rp)
00069 {
00070 #if defined(__KERNEL__) && BITS_PER_LONG == 32
00071     const unsigned long r = __div64_32(&ull, uld);
00072 #else /* !__KERNEL__ || BITS_PER_LONG == 64 */
00073     const unsigned long r = ull % uld;
00074     ull /= uld;
00075 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00076 
00077     if (rp)
00078         *rp = r;
00079 
00080     return ull;
00081 }
00082 
00083 #define rthal_uldivrem(ull,ul,rp) ((u_long) rthal_ulldiv((ull),(ul),(rp)))
00084 
00085 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00086 
00087     /* Returns (int)i = (unsigned long long)i*(u_long)(mult)/(u_long)div. */
00088     const unsigned long long ull = rthal_ullmul(i, mult);
00089     return rthal_uldivrem(ull, div, NULL);
00090 }
00091 
00092 static inline __attribute_const__
00093 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00094                                    const unsigned long m,
00095                                    const unsigned long d)
00096 {
00097     u_long oph, opl, tlh, tll, qh, rh, ql;
00098     unsigned long long th, tl;
00099 
00100     __rthal_u64tou32(op, oph, opl);
00101     tl = rthal_ullmul(opl, m);
00102     __rthal_u64tou32(tl, tlh, tll);
00103     th = rthal_ullmul(oph, m);
00104     th += tlh;
00105 
00106     qh = rthal_uldivrem(th, d, &rh);
00107     th = __rthal_u64fromu32(rh, tll);
00108     ql = rthal_uldivrem(th, d, NULL);
00109     return __rthal_u64fromu32(qh, ql);
00110 }
00111 
00112 static inline long long rthal_llimd (long long op,
00113                                      unsigned long m,
00114                                      unsigned long d)
00115 {
00116 
00117     if(op < 0LL)
00118         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00119     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00120 }

00122 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00123 
00124     __asm__ ("cntlzw %0, %1" : "=r" (ul) : "r" (ul & (-ul)));
00125     return 31 - ul;
00126 }

00143 static inline unsigned long long rthal_rdtsc (void) {
00144     unsigned long long t;
00145     rthal_read_tsc(t);
00146     return t;

00149 #if defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE) && !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00150 
00151 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the
00152    Xenomai domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task
00153    address using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack
00154    pointer instead. */
00155 
00156 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00157     return ((struct thread_info *)(rthal_root_domain->esp[cpuid] & (~8191UL)))->task;
00158 }
00159 
00160 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid)
00161 
00162 {
00163     register unsigned long esp asm ("r1");
00164     
00165     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 8192)
00166         return rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00167 
00168     return current;
00169 }
00170 
00171 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE || CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00172 
00173 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00174     return current;
00175 }
00176 
00177 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid) {
00178     return current;
00179 }
00180 
00181 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE && !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00183 static inline void rthal_timer_program_shot (unsigned long delay)
00184 {
00185     if(!delay) delay = 1;
00186 #ifdef CONFIG_40x
00187     mtspr(SPRN_PIT,delay);
00188 #else /* !CONFIG_40x */
00189     set_dec(delay);
00190 #endif /* CONFIG_40x */
00191 }

00202 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU

00204 typedef struct rthal_fpenv {
00205     
00206     /* This layout must follow exactely the definition of the FPU
00207        backup area in a PPC thread struct available from
00208        <asm-ppc/processor.h>. Specifically, fpr[] an fpscr words must
00209        be contiguous in memory (see arch/ppc/hal/fpu.S). */
00210 
00211     double fpr[32];
00212     unsigned long fpscr_pad;    /* <= Hi-word of the FPR used to */
00213     unsigned long fpscr;        /* retrieve the FPSCR. */
00214 
00215 } rthal_fpenv_t;
00216 
00217 void rthal_init_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00218 
00219 void rthal_save_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00220 
00221 void rthal_restore_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);

00223 #ifndef CONFIG_SMP
00224 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) last_task_used_math
00225 #else /* CONFIG_SMP */
00226 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) ({                             \
00227     struct task_struct * _cur = (cur);                          \
00228     ((_cur->thread.regs && (_cur->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))   \
00229      ? _cur : NULL);                                            \
00230 })
00231 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00232     
00233 #define rthal_disable_fpu() ({                          \
00234     register long _msr;                                 \
00235     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00236     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsr %0"                   \
00237                            : /* no output */            \
00238                            : "r"(_msr & ~(MSR_FP))      \
00239                            : "memory" );                \
00240 })
00241 
00242 #define rthal_enable_fpu() ({                           \
00243     register long _msr;                                 \
00244     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00245     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsr %0"                   \
00246                            : /* no output */            \
00247                            : "r"(_msr | MSR_FP)         \
00248                            : "memory" );                \
00249 })
00250 
00251 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
